p: Zika virus (ZIKV) was originally isolated from samples from the Zika forest in Uganda obtained from a rhesus monkey in 1947 [ 5]. The first cases of human infection were recorded in Nigeria and Tanzania from 1952â€“1954 [ 6], spreading slowly across the Asian continent. Before 2007, ZIKV was not considered a disease of substantial concern to human beings because only isolated cases involving small populations had been reported worldwide [ 7]. ZIKV transmission had previously only been documented in regions of Africa and Asia, but in 2007, it was detected in Yap, Micronesia, causing a small outbreak. Forty-nine ZIKV-infected cases were confirmed. In 2012/2013, it caused a new outbreak in French Polynesia, spreading across the other Pacific islands, resulting in an epidemic with more than 400 confirmed cases [ 8].
